u.a: Having got ready for the recording Jolanta is looking for Bartosz. Bartosz is playing prof. Weist on the sofa. Prof. Weist is sitting still. Bartosz is sort of hiding behind prof. Weist. Bartosz wants to draw everybody else's attention to what he is doing.
Bartosz keeps hiding behind prof . Weist and appearing back .
and what are you looking for ?
Bartosz has realized that we are following his every move . he starts rushing forth and back the rooms .
incorrect verb form . either "chodź-cie pan-ie" or "chodź-0 pan-i".
he must refer to his previous game of hide-and-seek .
but where are we looking for ?
prof . Weist and Bartosz are playing together . prof . Weist is rocking Bartosz on his knees .
bef pretends to have misunderstood Bartosz .
prof . Weist keeps rocking Bartosz on his knee .
Bartosz keeps playing around prof . Weist .
Bartosz keeps jumping around prof . Weist .
and what is he doing there ?
your father is thinking at work ?
Bartosz wants to leave . Jolanta makes him stay . she is asking him to tell her more about the father .
what does your father do at work ?
is daddy still acting as a dog ?
daddy is pretending (to be) a dog .
Bartosźs father used to act as a dog some weeks ago .
whom else does he pretend (to be) ?
Bartosz is sitting on the pillow . a passing car can be heard .
there is no car in sight .
can you see a car now ?
Bartosz is waving his hands carelessly .
a car appears down in the street . the car is identical to the one Bartosźs parents have .
Bartosz is looking at Jolanta and Zofia . Jolanta is taking notes and Zofia is holding her tape recorder .
does not have a ball pen .
Bartosz is leaving the room . he is rushing around the flat .
and what shall we be doing here ?
Bartosz makes a nice jump from a box onto a ball pen .
Bartosz pick up that ball pen ok ?
Bartosz calls prof . Weist an uncle .
Bartosz gets at the box with his toys .
V|must & IMPF:PRES:1S V|see & PFV-INF WH|what ADV|there V|be & IMPF:PRES:3S .
Jolanta is showing Bartosz a book about Bolek and Lolek, TV cartoon stars .
Bartosz look what I have got here ?
the form is incorrect . Bartosz should have said "pisz-ą" V|write_IMPF_PRES-3_P .
mother is in the kitchen . Bartosz is leaving the room . he is calling Jolanta and Zofia .
Bartosz organizes himself at the table . mother is serving drinks for Jolanta and Zofia .
and uncle come, uncle come, uncle here .
CONN|and N|uncle-DIM-MASC:NOM:S V|come & IMPF-IMP:2S N|uncle-DIM-MASC:NOM:S V|come & IMPF-IMP:2S N|uncle-DIM-MASC:NOM:S ADV|here ADV|here N|uncle-DIM-MASC:GEN:S !
what is that (what do you mean) ?
Bartosz has sat on a book .
I have sat on a book .
Jolanta picks up a plastic duck from the window sill .
but how does the duck sound ?
Bartosz suddenly rushes towards the door .
PRO|I & NOM:S PRO|you & DAT:S V|show & PFV:FUT-1S .
what are you going to show me ?
Bartosz has picked up a little ball from the floor .
Bartosz is back on the sofa . he is sitting on the book .
Bartosz stands up on the sofa and invites prof . Weist to a game . he is pulling prof . Weist's hands .
what are you doing with this book ?
what are you going to do with the uncle ?
some cars can be heard through the window . Bartosz is looking at them . he gets down on the floor . he is playing with a ball .
it is difficult to guess what Bartosz is referring to . mother explains that the father acts as a singing dog in a theatrical play .
I am kicking with my little leg (foot) .
Bartosz has kicked the ball again .
I am kicking with my little leg (foot) .
Bartosz has abandoned playing with the ball .
Bartosz keeps using the feminine form when referring to himself .
areńt you playing with the ball any more ?
Bartosz is looking for a ball again . he is searching under Jolanta'a feet .
Bartosz is talking to himself . Zofia wants to attract his attention . a noise can be heard from the street . some vehicle is passing by the house .
the family are going to move to another flat soon . amongst the suitcases and packages on the floor there is a ladder . Bartosz is pointing to the ladder .
Bartosz brings along a broken duck .
PRO|this & NEUT:NOM:S V|break & PFV-PASSPART-NEUT V|be & IMPF:PRES:3S .
what has happened to the toys ?
REFL|self V|happen & PFV-PAST-NEUT-3S WH|what REFL|self V|happen & PFV-PAST-NEUT-3S PREP|with N|toy-DIM-NONVIR:INSTR:P ?
Jolanta is showing Bartosz a duck without one leg .
bef points to prof . Weist's leg .
and where is the third leg ?
bef points to his own leg .
Bartosz is running around the room .
Jolanta i Zofia move towards the window . they are looking through it . they are asking Bartosz about his daddy . he cannot be seen .
what can you see there Bartosz ?
Bartosz is looking through the window . he is trying to open it .
look Bartosz what car is going there ?
can you see is it your daddy going ?
and what's the make of this car ?
Bartosz has left his place at the window sill .
Bartosz doesńt pay attention to his mother . he is playing the fool .
mother asks Bartosz whether he doesńt need to change his diaper .
and have you told us all about all your books ?
I have told about the books .
then bring a book about Bolek and Lolek .
and tell me where you can see Bolek and Lolek .
bef points to the TV set .
Bartosźs utterances are faint for he is chewing a ball pen . mother scolds him and takes the pen away .
mother has hidden the ball pen away .
bring a book about Bolek and Lolek .
there is no Bolek and Lolek here .
NEG|not V|have & IMPF:PRES:3S ADV|here PROP|Bolek-MASC:GEN:S CONN|and PROP|Lolek-MASC:GEN:S .
we will tell their story ok ?
bef Bartosz has just brought the book .
mother takes the book and asks Bartosz questions about the pictures .
bef mother is showing a river .
and what's sailing on the river ?
bef the picture shows a a ship .
during early recordings Bartosz called a lamp "red". now he seems to be referring to everyithing red as to a lamp .
the picture shows Bolek and Lolek .
the picture shows the captain of the red ship .
and what has the captain got ?
and what has the captain got on his head ?
and what has the capitain got here in his mouth ?
what has he got here in the mouth ?
WH|what ADV|here V|have & IMPF:PRES:3S PREP|in N|mouth-DIM-FEM:LOC:S ?
mother goes on to another story .
and now there is a story about Bolek and Lolek .
what have Bolek and Lolek done ?
< 1w > mother uses singular form of the verb referring to plural object .
and what were Bolek and Lolek doing ?
mother uses singular form of the verb referring to plural object .
Bartosz is playing around prof . Weist . he is mounting prof . Weist's knees .
I am walking on the uncle .
are you walking on the uncle ?
mother shows Bartosz another picture tale .
and what's the name of the fish ?
Bartosz is pointing to another picture of a boy . he is asking .
mother has pointed to a girl . the girl is holding a garland made of flowers .
and what has the girl got in her (little) hand ?
Batosz doesńt pay attention to his mother any longer . he is asking Jolanta .
and what are the children doing here ?
what is it you are writing ?
mother wants to get back to the book . Bartosz gets interested in the little holes in Zofia's shoes .
what are the children playing here ?
what is it you have here ?
Bartosz gets back to the book .
bef Bartosz is addressing his mother .
the picture shows a turtle . mother should not have referred to the turtle as "who".
one of the boys dressed up as a turtle, you know .
there is one on the table in the room .
fetch a book and another one .
this is sort of a summary of a baby poem about a locomotive standing at the station and puffing heavily
everybody present is laughing . Bartosz plays a fool again . mother tries to calm him down and asks him to "read" the book .
prof . Weist is showing Bartosz his own shoes .
can you see what nice shoes these are ?
Bartosz tell me what mother has been doing now ?
and what was she cleaning with ?
he just doesńt know what to say .
have you gone for a walk with mother ?
in the other room Bartosz has searched through Jolanta's handbag .
Batosz seems absent minded today . mother comments on this . she says 'the older Bartosz is the less he can concentrate his attention` .
it was noisy outside . Zofia closed the window .
it's me who closed the (little) window .
mother has poured some juice for Bartosz .
but where has mother poured into ?
what is here in the mug ?
prof . Weist is playing with Bartosz . Bartosz is enjoying this .
Bartosz gets interested in what Jolanta is writing . he is trying to take the pen away from her .
Bartosz makes a tour round the group and gets to Jolanta again . he is attracted by the pen .
fetch a pen then we will draw sketches .
prof . Weist has given Bartosz a ball pen .
mother will give it to you soon .
the uncle is giving you a ball pen .
have you given a ball pen ?
he gave you a ball pen .
Bartosz is writing funny figures on the notebook .
mother starts teasing Bartosz . she hides something in her hand and makes Bartosz guess what that is . Bartosz wants to see it . mother does not want to show him .
I'm not going to show you .
the thing is that I dońt want to show you .
Bartosz receives no answer . Jolanta is asking him about his newly drawn picture .
do you like drawing with uncle ?
bef an incorrect form of the verb . he should have said "napisz-0" unk#V|write-IMP_2_S .
prof . Weist is drawing something . Bartosz gets interested . he is looking at him .
the ball pen does not write .
Bartosz is making some lines in Jolanta's notebook . he asks about prof . Weist's picture . the picture shows a boy .
CONN|and PRO|this & NEUT:NOM:S WH|what V|be & IMPF:PRES:3S ?
Zofia approves . Bartosz is "talking" to prof Weist . prof Weist continues his drawing .
see what uncle has done Bartosz .
mother asks Bartosz questions about prof . Weist's new picture .
Bartosz is looking at the picture .
Bartosz wants Jolanta to follow him and leave the room . Jolanta opposes this proposition . Bartosz knows that Jolanta and Zofia always follow his every move .
Jolanta and Zofia did not follow Bartosz to the other room . he is back .
Bartosz takes a ball pen and scrawls Jolanta's notes again . mother tells him not to do that .
I am writing all you are saying .

mother enquires if Bartosz doesńt want to change his diaper . after she has set Bartosźs clothes in order he makes a tour round the room and comes back making a noise . Jolanta is busy talking . Bartosz has drawn some "pictures" in her notebook .
what have you done to me you naughty boy ?
son tell me where you were ?
were you at father's, at his work with mother ?
Bartosźs father is an actor . they talk about a visit to the theatre .
and tell me what characters took part in the play ?
and who had that long moustache and a ball ?
Aunt żywilka played a cat and she had a ball in her hand .
mother asks further questions about the role Bartosźs father had in the play . Bartosz keeps rather silent .
mother prompts Bartosz and says the other names of the characters of the story . Bartosz merely repeats them .
bef refers to big maple trees .
mother asks Bartosz to sing the song his father sang in the play .
bef answers the questions about what father did in the play .
a train is coming from afar .
Bartosz wants to write with Jolanta's pen .
Bartosz is busy with Jolanta's pen . mother keeps talking about the play .
mother asks about the name of another girl in the play . not knowing what to say Bartosz usually says his name .
mother keeps asking questions . Bartosz is too lazy to answer them . he only repeats mother's last words .
Bartosz tries to write with a ball pen . the ball pen is not on .
Jolanta is trying to get Bartosz interested in prof . Weist's picture .
Bartosz who has done this here ?
Bartosz doesńt listen to Jolanta . he is calling Zofia .
so what must one do with the ball pen son ?
and what else must one do ?
